result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven E Vetrone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven E Vetrone is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven E Vetrone was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven E Vetrone

defendant.name: Vetrone, Steven E
defendant.address: N3644 Blackhawk Rd, Pine River, WI 54965

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Clerk to Defendant re: Payment Arrangements

1:04 pm
Steven Vetrone appears in person without an attorney.
Defendant makes statement that he is currently unemployed, paying restitution and behind on other bills.  Requests to make $300 payment and set up payment plan.
Court authorizes warrant - stayed upon receipt of $300 payment today and monthly payments of $100 by the 15th of every month, beginning July 15, 2016.
Court adjourned at 1:06 pm

10:44 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Max Saylor.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - has received a letter.  Both counsel confirm receipt.  Atty Saylor recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 2 - DC with a fine and costs and count 1 will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on the Disorderly Conduct and orders the Battery be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Saylor.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$150 fine plus court costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 10:51 a.m.
from the victim - Keri S. in regards to the No Contact provisiion

NO CONTACT with Keri S.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

NO CONTACT with Keri S.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail.

1:03 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County jail and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  NO CONTACT with Keri S.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Court will set for Status Hearing on December 8, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:05 p.m.
